byline.contributor: Paula Moura contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil.

abstract: Conservative Brazilian lawmaker Eduardo Cunha, leader in movement to oust former president Dilma Rousseff, is expelled by lower house of Congress as he faces trial on graft charges; expulsion of powerful politician, in landslide vote, underscores continuing governmental chaos in country.
lead_paragraph: The lower house of Congress voted overwhelmingly Monday night to expel Eduardo Cunha, a conservative lawmaker who is facing graft charges.
snippet: The lower house of Congress voted overwhelmingly Monday night to expel Eduardo Cunha, a conservative lawmaker who is facing graft charges....

headline.main: Brazil’s Congress Expels Lawmaker Who Led Ouster of President
headline.print_headline: Brazilian Congress Expels Lawmaker Who Led Ouster of President
